Biography

David Hunkin was born in England.

David Hunkin migrated from United Kingdom to United States.

David Andrew Myles Hunkin was born on 7 July 1930 in St Austell, Cornwall, England, United Kingdom, son of James Hunkin (1884–1970) and Francis Violet Grose (1888–1969).[1]

His siblings were:

Verona Hunkin (21 December 1912 – unknown)

James Hunkin (10 June 1918 – 27 December 1978)

Patricia Grose Hunkin (1920 – unknown)

Monica Joy Hunkin (6 October 1923 – 22 August 2001)

David died on 15 May 2003 in United States, aged 72.

Mr. Myles-Hunkin, who lived in Hyattsville, was born in Cornwall, England. He came to the United States in 1947. As a young man, he studied music in New York and California and at Peabody Conservatory in Baltimore. He was a purchasing agent in Baltimore for Owens Yacht before moving to the Washington area in 1965.

His marriage to Nona Myles-Hunkin ended in divorce.

David married Nona Elizabeth Myles (born on 21 September 1930 in Maryland, United States). Their known children were:

Patricia Elizabeth Myles Hunkin (6 October 1953 – unknown)

Andrea N Hunkin (3 March 1958 – unknown)

He was a purchasing agent with Potomac Ironworks, Yeonas Organization home builders and Carpet Specialist. In 1972, with his wife, Jean, he founded Sparkle Cleaning Services Inc., which specialized in cleaning new homes, apartments and condominiums. He retired in 1995.

In 1995, David (65) was living in Bethany Beach, Delaware, United States.

In 1992, David (62) was living in Hyattsville, Maryland, United States.

In 2001, David (71) was living in Hyattsville, Maryland, United States.

David Andrew Myles-Hunkin, 73, a retired businessman who for 23 years operated Sparkle Cleaning Service with his wife, died 15 May 2003 at Washington Adventist Hospital. He had cancer and kidney failure.[2]
